title: The Importance of Teaching Motivation and Design Methods: A Regression Analysis-Based Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Optimized Instructional Design for Accessible Online Platforms via Smartphones, Measuring Learning Outcomes Through Project-Based Assessment

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish types of teaching motivation (intrinsic, identified, externally regulated) and explain their impact on instructional design.
Learners can analyze correlations between teaching motivation and instructional design methods through regression analysis using survey data.
Learners can propose effective instructional design strategies in limited technological environments (smartphone-centric) and apply them to project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
